Circular No. 3 / 2007 
 
In continuation of  this Bureau Circular No. 5/2003 dated 19.1.2003 
regarding Web Check –in system for passengers at the airports  and in view of 
the growing demand of the passengers and in order to cut down on queue time 
at check-in counters, a proposal of the airlines to permit web check-in facility was 
examined by this Bureau (based on deliberations and decision taken in  meeting 
held on 20.10.2006). Accordingly, following security guidelines for web check-in 
system at airports in India shall be strictly followed by the concerned 
departments/ agencies/ passengers : 
 
(i) 
The web boarding cards should be the  exact replica of the 
boarding cards presently in vogue to avoid any confusion during 
checking by the APSU/ ASG staff at the terminal entry gates 
onwards. 
 
(ii) 
Airlines will organize on-the-job training for CISF personnel on the 
electronically generated web boarding cards to  familiarize them 
with any special  features of the Boarding  Cards to  establish their  
authenticity. 
 
(iii) 
On arrival at IGI Airport, passengers will present  their  tickets, e-
tickets printouts and the self-printed 2D boarding passes at the 
terminal entry gates alongwith identity documents. 
 
(iv) 
Bar Code  on the  Boarding Cards  shall be mandatory. Airlines 
staff at the check-in counters will check the authentication of the 2D 
bar coded boarding passes alongwith the travel documents i.e. e-
tickets and   identity documents.  
 
(v) 
The boarding pass will be stamped by the airlines staff as a proof of 
authentication. Passengers will then proceed for immigration 
clearance, custom checks and security checks with the 2D self-
boarding passes. 
 
2. 
The above instructions shall be implemented with effect from 15th  March , 
2007. 
 
(M. Malaviya)
